intro: Ossaea polychaete, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, bract-like leaves that resemble those of holly, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in coastal environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Ossaea polychaete is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate harsh maritime conditions.
